class.name: Artificer

tools: one type of {@item artisan's tools|Ishiir} of your choice

dIshiirult: any two {@filter simple weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon} of your choice
a {@item light crossbow|phb} and {@item crossbow bolts (20)|phb|20 bolts}
(a) {@item studded leather armor|phb} or (b) {@item scale mail|phb}
{@item thieves' tools|phb} and a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb}

classFeatures: The Right Tool for the Job|Artificer|Ishiir|3

classFeature.name: Magical Tinkering
entries: You learn how to invest a spark of magic into mundane objects. To use this ability, you must have {@item thieves' tools|PHB} or {@item artisan's tools|Ishiir} in hand. You then touch a Tiny nonmagical object as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} and give it one of the following magical properties of your choice:

items: The object sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.

Whenever tapped by a creature, the object emits a recorded message that can be heard up to 10 feet away. You utter the message when you bestow this property on the object, and the recording can be no more than 6 seconds long.
The object continuously emits your choice of an odor or a nonverbal sound (wind, waves, chirping, or the like). The chosen phenomenon is perceivable up to 10 feet away.
A static visual effect appears on one of the object's surfaces. This effect can be a picture, up to 25 words of text, lines and shapes, or a mixture of these elements, as you like.

entries: The chosen property lasts indefinitely. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can touch the object and end the property early.

You can bestow magic on multiple objects, touching one object each time you use this feature, though a single object can only bear one property at a time. The maximum number of objects you can affect with this feature at one time is equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of one object). If you try to exceed your maximum, the oldest property immediately ends, and then the new property applies.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: You have studied the workings of magic and how to channel it through objects. As a result, you have gained the ability to cast spells. To observers, you don't appear to be casting spells in a conventional way; you look as if you're producing wonders using mundane items or outlandish inventions. The information below details how you use those rules with Artificer spells, which appear on the {@filter Artificer spell list|spells|class=artificer (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}.

entries.name: Tools Required
entries: You produce your artificer spell effects through your tools. You must have a spellcasting focus—specifically {@item thieves' tools|phb} or some kind of {@item artisan's tools|Ishiir|artisan's tool}—in hand when you cast any spell with this Spellcasting feature (meaning the spell has an 'M' component when you cast it). You must be {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} with the tool to use it in this way. See {@book chapter 5|PHB|4}, "Equipment," in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB} for descriptions of these tools.
After you gain the Infuse Item feature at 2nd level, you can also use any item bearing one of your infusions as a spellcasting focus.

entries.name: The Magic of Artifice
entries: As an artificer, you use tools when you cast your spells. When describing your spellcasting, think about how you're using a tool to perform the spell effect. If you cast {@spell Cure Wounds|Ishiir} using {@item alchemist's supplies|Ishiir}, you could be quickly producing a salve. If you cast it using {@item tinker's tools|Ishiir}, you might have a miniature mechanical spider that binds wounds. When you cast {@spell Poison Spray|Ishiir}, you could fling foul chemicals or use a wand that spits venom. The effect of the spell is the same as for a spellcaster of any other class, but your method of spellcasting is special.

The same principle applies when you prepare your spells. As an artificer, you don't study a spellbook or pray to prepare your spells. Instead, you work with your tools and create the specialized items you'll use to produce your effects. If you replace {@spell Cure Wounds|Ishiir} with {@spell Heat Metal|Ishiir}, you might be altering the device you use to heal—perhaps modifying a tool so that it channels heat instead of healing energy.

Such details don't limit you in any way or provide you with any benefit beyond the spell's effects. You don't have to justify how you're using tools to {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell}. But describing your spellcasting creatively is a fun way to distinguish yourself from other spellcasters.

entries.name: Cantrips.
entries: You know two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Artificer spell list|spells|level=0|class=Artificer (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}. At higher levels, you learn additional artificer cantrips of your choice, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Artificer table.
When you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the artificer cantrips you know with another cantrip from the artificer spell list.

entries.name: Spell Slots.
entries: The Artificer Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+.
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose four level 1 spells from the {@filter Artificer spell list|spells|class=artificer (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Artificer levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Artificer Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional spells from the Artificer spell list until the number of spells on your list matches the number on the table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 5 Artificer, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of levels 1 and 2 in any combination.

If another Artificer feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Artificer spells for you.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells.
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir}, you can replace one of your prepared spells with another Artificer spell for which you have spell slots.
Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you can change your list of prepared spells, replacing any of the spells there with other Artificer spells for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability.
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your artificer spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus.
entries: You can use yoru tools as a Spellcasting Focus for your Artificer spells.

classFeature.name: Tinker's Magic
entries: You know the {@spell Mending|Ishiir} cantrip.
As a {@action Magic|Ishiir} action while holding {@item Tinker's Tools|Ishiir}, you can create one item in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of yourself, choosing the item from the following list:
The item lasts until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, at which point it vanishes.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

classFeature.name: Infuse Item
entries: You gain the ability to imbue mundane items with certain magical infusions. The magic items you create with this feature are effectively prototypes of permanent items.

entries.name: Artificer Infusions
entries: Artificers have invented numerous magical infusions, extraordinary processes that rapidly create magic items. To many, artificers seem like wonderworkers, accomplishing in hours what others need weeks to complete.
The description of each of the following infusions details the type of item that can receive it, along with whether the resulting magic item requires attunement.
Some infusions specify a minimum artificer level. You can't learn such an infusion until you are at least that level.
Unless an infusion's description says otherwise, you can't learn an infusion more than once.

entries.name: Infusing an Item
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you can touch a nonmagical object and imbue it with one of your artificer infusions, turning it into a magic item. An infusion works on only certain kinds of objects, as specified in the infusion's description. If the item requires attunement, you can attune yourself to it the instant you infuse the item. If you decide to attune to the item later, you must do so using the normal process for attunement (see "Attunement" in chapter 7 of the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}).

Your infusion remains in an item indefinitely, but when you die, the infusion vanishes after a number of days have passed equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 day). The infusion also vanishes if you give up your knowledge of the infusion for another one.

You can infuse more than one nonmagical object at the end of a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}; the maximum number of objects appears in the Infused Items column of the Artificer table. You must touch each of the objects, and each of your infusions can be in only one object at a time. Moreover, no object can bear more than one of your infusions at a time. If you try to exceed your maximum number of infusions, the oldest infusion immediately ends, and then the new infusion applies.
If an infusion ends on an item that contains other things, like a bag of holding, its contents harmlessly appear in and around its space.

classFeature.name: Infusions Known
entries: When you gain this feature, pick four artificer infusions to learn, choosing from the "{@filter Artificer Infusions|optionalfeatures|feature type=ai|source=Ishiir}" section at the end of the class's description. You learn additional infusions of your choice when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Infusions Known column of the Artificer table.
Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the artificer infusions you learned with a new one.

classFeature.name: Artificer Specialist
entries: You choose the type of specialist you are, each of which is detailed at the end of the class's description. Your choice grants you features at 5th level and again at 9th and 15th level.

classFeature.name: The Right Tool for the Job
entries: You learn how to produce exactly the tool you need: with {@item thieves' tools|PHB} or {@item artisan's tools|Ishiir} in hand, you can magically create one set of {@item artisan's tools|Ishiir} in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. This creation requires 1 hour of uninterrupted work, which can coincide with a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. Though the product of magic, the tools are nonmagical, and they vanish when you use this feature again.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Artificer Specialist Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Artificer Specialist choice.

classFeature.name: Tool Expertise
entries: Your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus is doubled for any {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir} you make that uses your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with a tool.

classFeature.name: Flash of Genius
entries: When you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you fails an ability check or a saving throw, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to add a bonus to the roll, potentially causing it to succeed. The bonus equals your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

You can take this {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Artificer Specialist Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Artificer Specialist choice.

classFeature.name: Magic Item Adept
entries: You achieve a profound understanding of how to use and make magic items:

items: You can attune to up to four magic items at once.
If you craft a magic item with a rarity of common or uncommon, it takes you a quarter of the normal time, and it costs you half as much of the usual gold.

classFeature.name: Spell-Storing Item
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you can touch one Simple or Martial weapon or one item that you can use as a Spellcasting Focus, and you store a spell in it, choosing a level 1, 2, or 3 Artificer spell that has a casting time of an action and doesn't require a Material component that is consumed by the spell (you needn't have the spell prepared).

While holding the object, a creature can take a {@action Magic|Ishiir} action to produce the spell's effect from it, using your spellcasting ability modifier. If the spell requires {@condition Concentration|Ishiir}, the creature must concentrate. Once a creature has used the object to produce the spell's effect, the object can't be used this way again until the start of the creature's next turn.
The spell stays in the object until it's been used a number of times equal to twice your Intelligence modifier (minimum of twice) or until you use this feature again to store a spell in an object.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Advanced Artifice
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Magic Item Savant
entries: You can now attune to up to five magic items at once.

entries.name: Refreshed Genius
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir}, you regain one expended use of your Flash of Genius feature.

classFeature.name: Artificer Specialist Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Artificer Specialist choice.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Magic Item Master
entries: You can attune to up to six magic items at once.
Additionally, you ignore all class, race, spell, and level requirements on attuning to or using a magic item.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Soul of Artifice
entries: You develop a mystical connection to your magic items, which you can draw on for protection:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to all {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} per magic item you are currently attuned to.
If you're reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to expend a use of Flash of Genius and change your hit points to 20 instead.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemist
entries: An Alchemist is an expert at combining reagents to produce mystical effects. Alchemists use their creations to give life and to leech it away. Alchemy is the oldest of artificer traditions, and its versatility has long been valued during times of war and peace.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemist Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Alchemist Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with {@item alchemist's supplies|Ishiir}. If you already have this {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}, you gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with one other type of {@item artisan's tools|Ishiir} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Experimental Elixir
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you can magically produce a number of {@i experimental elixirs} equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in empty flasks you touch. Roll on the Experimental Elixir table for each elixir's effect, which is triggered when someone drinks the elixir. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, a creature can drink the elixir or administer it to an {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} creature.

Creating an {@i experimental elixir} requires you to have {@item alchemist's supplies|Ishiir} on your person, and any elixir you create with this feature lasts until it is drunk or until the end of your next {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

You can create additional {@i experimental elixirs} by expending a spell slot of 1st level or higher for each one. When you do so, you use your {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to create the elixir in an empty flask you touch, and you choose the elixir's effect from the Experimental Elixir table.

entries.caption: Experimental Elixir
rows: {@b Healing}. The drinker regains a number of hit points equal to {@dice 2d4} + your Intelligence modifier.
{@b Swiftness}. The drinker's walking {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} increases by 10 feet for 1 hour.
{@b Resilience}. The drinker gains a +1 bonus to AC for 10 minutes.
{@b Boldness}. The drinker can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to every {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} they make for the next minute.
{@b Flight}. The drinker gains a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} of 10 feet for 10 minutes.

{@b Transformation}. The drinker's body is transformed as if by the {@spell Alter Self|Ishiir} spell. The drinker determines the transformation caused by the spell, the effects of which last for 10 minutes.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemical Savant
entries: You develop masterful command of magical chemicals, enhancing the healing and damage you create through them. Whenever you cast a spell while you have {@item alchemist's supplies|Ishiir} on your person, you gain a bonus to one roll of the spell. That roll must restore hit points or be a damage roll that deals acid, fire, necrotic, or poison damage, and the bonus equals your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Restorative Reagents
entries: You can incorporate restorative reagents into some of your works:

items: Whenever a creature drinks an {@i experimental elixir} you created, the creature gains temporary hit points equal to {@dice 2d6} + your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 temporary hit point).

You can cast {@spell Lesser Restoration|Ishiir} without expending a spell slot and without preparing the spell, provided you have {@item alchemist's supplies|Ishiir} on your person. You can do so a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Chemical Mastery
entries: You have been exposed to so many chemicals that they pose little risk to you, and you can use them to quickly end certain ailments:

items: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to acid damage and poison damage, and you are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} condition.

You can cast {@spell Greater Restoration|Ishiir} and {@spell Heal|Ishiir} without expending a spell slot, without preparing the spell, and without material components, provided you have {@item alchemist's supplies|Ishiir} on your person. Once you cast either spell with this feature, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.
{@b Potent Healing}: When you cast an Artificer spell that restores hit points, you treat the spell as two spell levels higher for the purpose of determining the amount of hit points restored.

subclassFeature.name: Armorer
entries: An artificer who specializes as an Armorer modifies armor to function almost like a second skin. The armor is enhanced to hone the artificer's magic, unleash potent attacks, and generate a formidable defense. The artificer bonds with this armor, becoming one with it even as they experiment with it and refine its magical capabilities.

subclassFeature.name: Dampening Field
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}. If the armor normally imposes {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on such {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}, the {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} cancel each other, as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Defensive Field
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can gain temporary hit points equal to 5 times your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus, replacing any temporary hit points you already have. You lose these temporary hit points if you doff the armor. You can use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus. You regain one expended use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Lightning Launcher
entries: A gemlike node appears on one of your armored fists or on the chest (your choice). It counts as a simple ranged weapon, with a normal range of 90 feet and a long range of 300 feet, and it deals {@damage 1d6} lightning damage on a hit. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with it, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d6} lightning damage to that target.
Both initial and rider effect damage increases when you reach 11th ({@damage 1d8}) and 17th ({@damage 1d10}) level.

subclassFeature.name: Powered Steps
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} increases by 5 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Force Demolisher
entries: An arcane wrecking ball or sledgehammer projects from your armor. The demolisher counts as a Simple Melee weapon with the Reach property, and it deals {@damage 1d10} Force damage on a hit. If you hit a creature that is no more than one size larger than you with the demolisher, you can push the creature up to 10 feet straight away from yourself or pull the creature up to 10 feet toward yourself.
The damage increases when you reach 11th ({@damage 2d6}) and 17th ({@damage 2d8}) level.

subclassFeature.name: Giant Stature
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you transform and enlarge your armor for 1 minute. For the duration, your reach increases by 5 feet, and if you are smaller than Large, you become Large, along with anything you are wearing. If there isn't enough room for you to increase your size, your size doesn't change. You can use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Thunder Gauntlets
entries: Each of the armor's gauntlets counts as a simple melee weapon while you aren't holding anything in it, and it deals {@damage 1d8} thunder damage on a hit. A creature hit by the gauntlet has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against targets other than you until the start of your next turn, as the armor magically emits a distracting pulse when the creature attacks someone else.
The damage increases when you reach 11th ({@damage 1d10}) and 17th ({@damage 1d12}) level.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Armor
entries: Your metallurgical pursuits have led to you making armor a conduit for your magic. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can turn a suit of armor you are wearing into Arcane Armor, provided you have {@item armorsmith's tools|Ishiir} in hand.
You gain the following benefits while wearing this armor:

items: If the armor normally has a Strength requirement, the arcane armor lacks this requirement for you.
You can use the arcane armor as a spellcasting focus for your artificer spells.

The armor attaches to you and can't be removed against your will. It also expands to cover your entire body, although you can retract or deploy the helmet as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}. The armor replaces any missing limbs, functioning identically to a limb it replaces.
You can doff or don the armor as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}. The armor continues to be Arcane Armor until you don another suit of armor or you die.

subclassFeature.name: Armor Model
entries: You can customize your Arcane Armor. When you do so, choose one of the following armor models: Guardian or Infiltrator. The model you choose gives you special benefits while you wear it.

Each model includes a special weapon. When you attack with that weapon, you can add your Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, to the attack and damage rolls. If your armor has an enhancement bonus, it is added to these attack and damage rolls.
You can change the armor's model whenever you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, provided you have {@item armorsmith's tools|Ishiir} in hand.

entries.name: Dreadnought
entries: You design your armor to become a towering juggernaut in battle. It has the following features:

entries.name: Guardian
entries: You design your armor to be in the front line of conflict. It has the following features:

entries.name: Infiltrator
entries: You customize your armor for subtle undertakings. It has the following features:

subclassFeature.name: Armorer Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Armorer Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with heavy armor. You also gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with {@item armorsmith's tools|Ishiir}. If you already have this tool {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}, you gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with one other type of {@item artisan's tools|Ishiir} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Armor Modifications
entries: You learn how to use your artificer infusions to specially modify your Arcane Armor. That armor now counts as separate items for the purposes of your Infuse Items feature: armor (the chest piece), boots, helmet, and the armor's special weapon. Each of those items can bear one of your infusions, and the infusions transfer over if you change your armor's model with the Armor Model feature. In addition, the maximum number of items you can infuse at once increases by 2, but those extra items must be part of your Arcane Armor.

subclassFeature.name: Perfected Armor
entries: Your Arcane Armor gains additional benefits based on its model, as shown below.

entries.name: Dreadnought
entries: When you use your Giant Stature, your reach increases by 10 feet, your size can increase to Large or Huge (your choice), and you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Strength {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Checks} and Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} for the duration.

When you hit a creature with your Force Demolisher, creatures within 10 ft of it also take {@damage 2d6} force damage. Additionally, the original target and every affected creature around it have to make a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your Spell save DC. On a failure, they are knocked {@condition Prone|Ishiir}. A creature makes this {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} only once per turn.

entries.name: Guardian
entries: When a Huge or smaller creature you can see ends its turn within 30 feet of you, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to magically force it to make a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC. On a failed save, you pull the creature up to 25 feet directly to an unoccupied space. If you pull the target to a space within 5 feet of you, you can make a melee weapon attack against it as part of this {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir}.

You can use this {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Infiltrator
entries: Any creature that takes lightning damage from your Lightning Launcher glimmers with magical light until the start of your next turn. The glimmering creature sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius, and it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against you, as the light jolts it if it attacks you. In addition, the next {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against it has {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}, and if that attack hits, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d12} lightning damage.

subclassFeature.name: Artillerist
entries: An Artillerist specializes in using magic to hurl energy, projectiles, and explosions on a battlefield. This destructive power was valued by all the armies of the Last War. Now that the war is over, some members of this specialization have sought to build a more peaceful world by using their powers to fight the resurgence of strife in Khorvaire.

The gnome artificer Vi, an unlikely yet key member of House Cannith's warforged project, has been especially vocal about making things right: "It's about time we fixed things instead of blowing them all to hell."

subclassFeature.name: Artillerist Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Artillerist Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

entries.caption: Artillerist Spells
rows: {@spell Cone of Cold|Ishiir}, {@spell Wall of Force|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with {@item woodcarver's tools|Ishiir}. If you already have this {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}, you gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with one other type of {@item artisan's tools|Ishiir} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Cannon
entries: You learn how to create a magical cannon. Using {@item woodcarver's tools|Ishiir} or {@item weaponsmith's tools|Ishiir}, you can take an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to magically create a Small or Tiny eldritch cannon in an unoccupied space on a horizontal surface within 5 feet of you. A Small eldritch cannon occupies its space, and a Tiny one can be held in one hand.

Once you create a cannon, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} or until you expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher. You can have only one cannon at a time and can't create one while your cannon is present.

The cannon is a magical object. Regardless of size, the cannon has an AC of 18 and a number of hit points equal to five times your artificer level. It is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to poison damage and psychic damage, and all conditions. If it is forced to make an {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir} or a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, treat all its ability scores as 10 (+0). If the {@spell Mending|Ishiir} spell is cast on it, it regains {@dice 2d6} hit points. It disappears if it is reduced to 0 hit points or after 1 hour. You can dismiss it early as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}.

When you create the cannon, you determine its appearance and whether it has legs. You also decide which type it is, choosing from the options on the Eldritch Cannons table. On each of your turns, when you take your {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can cause the cannon to activate if you are within 60 feet of it and fire at the closest hostile creature. Alternatively, you can use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to designate the target creature manually. As part of the same {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can direct the cannon to walk or climb up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space, provided it has legs.

entries.caption: Eldritch Cannons
rows: The cannon exhales fire in an adjacent 15-foot cone that you designate. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC, taking {@damage 2d8} fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

Make a ranged spell attack, originating from the cannon, at one creature or object within 120 feet of it. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d8} force damage, and if the target is a creature, it is pushed up to 5 feet away from the cannon.

The cannon emits a burst of positive energy that grants itself and each creature of your choice within 10 feet of it a number of temporary hit points equal to {@damage 1d8} + your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Firearm
entries: You know how to turn a wand, staff, or rod into an arcane firearm, a conduit for your destructive spells. When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you can use {@item woodcarver's tools|Ishiir} to carve special sigils into a wand, staff, or rod and thereby turn it into your arcane firearm. The sigils disappear from the object if you later carve them on a different item. The sigils otherwise last indefinitely.

You can use your arcane firearm as a spellcasting focus for your artificer spells. When you cast an artificer spell through the firearm, roll a {@damage d8}, and you gain a bonus to one of the spell's damage rolls equal to the number rolled.

subclassFeature.name: Explosive Cannon
entries: Every Eldritch Cannon you create is now more destructive. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Detonate
entries: When your cannon takes damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to command the cannon to detonate if you are within 60 feet of it. Doing so destroys the cannon and forces each creature within 20 feet of it to make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@damage 3d10} Force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Firepower
entries: The cannon's damage rolls and the number of Temporary Hit Points granted by Protector increase by {@dice 1d8}.

subclassFeature.name: Fortified Position
entries: You're a master at forming well-defended emplacements using Eldritch Cannon:

items: You and your allies have half cover while within 10 feet of a cannon you create with Eldritch Cannon, as a result of a shimmering field of magical protection that the cannon emits.

You can now have two cannons at the same time. You can create two with the same action (but not the same spell slot), and you can activate both of them with the same {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}. You determine whether the cannons are identical to each other or different. You can't create a third cannon while you have two.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Smith
entries: Armies require protection, and someone has to put things back together if defenses fail. A combination of protector and medic, a Battle Smith is an expert at defending others and repairing both material and personnel. To aid in their work, Battle Smiths are usually accompanied by a steel defender, a protective companion of their own creation. Many soldiers tell stories of nearly dying before being saved by a Battle Smith and a steel defender.

Battle Smiths played a key role in House Cannith's work on battle constructs and the original warforged, and after the Last War, these artificers led efforts to aid those who were injured in the war's horrific battles.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Ready
entries: Your combat training and your experiments with magic have paid off in two ways:

items: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with martial weapons.
When you attack with a magic weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity modifier, for the attack and damage rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Smith Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Battle Smith Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Steel Defender
entries: Your tinkering has borne you a faithful companion, a {@creature steel defender|tce}. It is friendly to you and your companions, and it obeys your commands. See this creature's game statistics in the steel defender stat block, which uses your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus (PB) in several places. You determine the creature's appearance and whether it has two legs or four; your choice has no effect on its game statistics.

In combat, the defender shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. If you are small enough to ride it, you can direct it to use its movement on your turn (no action required). It otherwise prioritizes following you and defending you from threats and then itself. If you take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} on your turn, you can command it to take specific actions. These actions can be one in its stat block or some other action and can be taken during your turn rather than the defender's.

If the {@spell Mending|Ishiir} spell is cast on it, it regains {@dice 2d6} hit points. If it has died within the last hour, you can use your {@item armorsmith's tools|Ishiir} as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to revive it, provided you are within 5 feet of it and you expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher. The steel defender returns to life after 1 minute with all its hit points restored.

At the end of a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you can create a new steel defender if you have your {@item armorsmith's tools|Ishiir} with you. If you already have a steel defender from this feature, the first one immediately perishes. The defender also perishes if you die.

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with {@item armorsmith's tools|Ishiir}. If you already have this {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}, you gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with one other type of {@item artisan's tools|Ishiir} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Jolt
entries: You learn new ways to channel arcane energy to harm or heal. When either you hit a target with a magic weapon attack or your steel defender hits a target, you can channel magical energy through the strike to create one of the following effects:

items: The target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} force damage.
Choose one creature or object you can see within 30 feet of the target. Healing energy flows into the chosen recipient, restoring {@dice 2d6} hit points to it.

entries: You can use this energy a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), but you can do so no more than once on a turn. You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Defender
entries: Your Arcane Jolt and steel defender become more powerful:

items: The extra damage and the healing of your Arcane Jolt both increase to {@damage 4d6}.
Your steel defender gains a +2 bonus to Armor Class.
Whenever your steel defender uses its Deflect Attack, the attacker takes force damage equal to {@damage 1d4} + your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Adventurer's Atlas
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} while holding {@item Cartographer's Tools|Ishiir}, you can use that tool to create a set of magical maps by touching at least two creatures (one of whom can be yourself), up to a maximum number of creatures equal to 1 plus your Intelligence modifier (minimum of two creatures). Each target receives a magical map, which constantly updates to show the relative position of all the map holders but is illegible to all others. The maps last until you die or until you use this feature again, at which point any existing maps created by this feature immediately vanish.
While carrying the map, a target gains the following benefits.

entries.name: Awareness
entries: The target adds {@dice 1d4} to its {@variantrule Initiative|Ishiir} rolls.

entries.name: Positioning
entries: The target knows the location of all other map holders that are on the same plane of existence as itself. When casting a spell or creating another effect that requires being able to see the effect's target, a map holder can target another map holder regardless of sight or cover, so long as the other map holder is still within the effect's range.

subclassFeature.name: Plane Charter Spells
entries: When you reach an Artificer level specified in the Cartographer Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Mapping Magic
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Illuminated Cartography
entries: You can cast {@spell Faerie Fire|Ishiir} without expending a spell slot, outlining the affected creatures as if in ink. You can do so a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Portal Jump
entries: On your turn, you can spend an amount of movement equal to half your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} (round down) to teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 10 feet of yourself or within 5 feet of a creature that is within 30 feet of you and holding one of your Adventurer's Atlas maps. You can't use this benefit if your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} is 0.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item Calligrapher's Supplies|Ishiir} and {@item Cartographer's Tools|Ishiir}. If you already have one of these proficiencies, you gain proficiency with one other type of {@item Artisan's Tools|Ishiir} of your choice (or with two other types if you have both).

entries.name: Scroll Crafting
entries: When you craft a Spell Scroll, the amount of time required to craft it is halved.

subclassFeature.name: Guided Precision
entries: Once per turn, whenever you cast a spell from your Cartographer Spells list or hit a creature affected by your {@spell Faerie Fire|Ishiir} with an attack roll, you can add your Intelligence modifier to one damage roll of the spell or attack.
In addition, taking damage can't cause you to lose {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} on {@spell Faerie Fire|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Ingenious Movement
entries: When you use your Flash of Genius, you or a willing creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of yourself can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see as part of that same {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Superior Atlas
entries: Your Adventurer's Atlas improves, gaining the following benefits.

entries.name: Safe Haven
entries: When a map holder would be reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|Ishiir} but not killed outright, that creature can destroy its map. The creature's {@variantrule Hit Points|Ishiir} instead change to a number equal to twice your Artificer level, and the creature is teleported to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you or another map holder of its choice.

entries.name: Unerring Path
entries: If you are one of the map holders for your Adventurer's Atlas, you can cast {@spell Find the Path|Ishiir} without expending a spell slot, without preparing the spell, and without needing spell components. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.
